alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Dickens; Garza; Kent (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 29 at 7:46PM CDT until August 29 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR WESTERN KENT...SOUTHWESTERN DICKENS...GARZA AND SOUTHEASTERN CROSBY COUNTIES... At 744 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Mcadoo to 6 miles east of Grassland, moving south at 15 mph. Wind gusts of 60 to 65 mph have been measured with this line of storms by mesonets located west of White River Lake and near Graham. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Post, Crosbyton, Spur, Dickens, Lake Alan Henry, White River Lake, Kalgary and Justiceburg. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near Lake Alan Henry, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
